title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics' Luka Garza scored 16 points in 17 minutes, contributing heavily to a 111-107 win over the Magic.
Anfernee Simons scored 25 first-half points, helping Celtics build a double-digit lead.
Celtics' bench outperformed starters in 3-point shooting, with Simons, Walsh, and González going 8-for-11.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek has signed a new contract to continue as the Boston Red Sox's game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek, a key figure in the Red Sox's coaching staff, has expressed satisfaction with the team's leadership and growth opportunities.
Catchers like Carlos Narvaez have benefited from Varitek's coaching, with Narvaez having a standout rookie season in 2025.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots' rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams and Henderson combined for 222 of New England's 435 total offensive yards, showcasing their explosive playmaking skills.
Rookie contributions were key, including defensive efforts from Craig Woodson and Elijah Ponder against Tampa Bay.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is the current NFL MVP frontrunner according to FanDuel and other oddsmakers.
Drake Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Drake Maye has completed 71.7% of passes this season, accumulating 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and five interceptions.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract to officially retire as a New England Patriot this week.
Gronkowski, a former Patriots tight end, won three Super Bowls with the team and holds 79 career receiving touchdowns.
In retirement, Gronkowski co-hosts a podcast with Julian Edelman and works for Fox Sports in NFL broadcasting.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams led the Patriots with crucial touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Patriots' defense struggled to contain Emeka Egbuka, but made key plays to secure their seventh consecutive victory.
Tight ends Austin Hooper and Hunter Henry were non-factors in the Patriots' offensive scheme against Tampa Bay.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots defeated Buccaneers 28-23, extending their winning streak to seven games and strengthening playoff prospects.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams were pivotal, scoring three touchdowns and contributing 222 of 435 yards.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns despite a late interception, continuing his promising season.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, charged with drunk driving after crashing into a pole on Oct. 19.
Daveiga was arrested and charged for operating under the influence following a crash at Leverett Circle intersection.
He pleaded not guilty and is on modified duty; next court date set for December 19.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine employees with work permits were detained by ICE during a Nov. 4 raid at Allston Car Wash.
The detainment has faced criticism from local politicians, citing the denial of document retrieval and mistreatment.
ICE claims the workers entered the U.S. illegally, while legal teams struggle with information access and detainment conditions.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Nov. 8, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser rose to fame in 2024 after a standout performance at the Tom Brady roast.
Highlights included Glaser's monologue and Pete Davidson's return to 'Weekend Update.'
